text: Subnets A subnet is a section of a VPC in which you can group resources based on security or operational needs. Subnets can be public or private. =1 AWS Cloud VPC Public subnets contain resources that need to be . A accessible by the public, such as an online store's 5 Public subnet website. j:} {::} i:} Private subnets contain resources that should be accessible only through your private network, such as Amazon EC2 instances a database that contains customers' personal information and order histories. Private subnet In a VPC, subnets can communicate with each other. For example, you might have an application that involves Amazon EC2 instances in a public subnet communicating with databases that are located in a Databases private subnet.
